page.title: 16THE TROUT LAKE-CHESTERTON
page.content: The landowner owns about 1000 acres.He does lots towards conservation.He had the idea of making a trout lake because he thought it was a lovely place.The lake is 12 acres in size. They do not buy fish because they breed them.The fishermen have a competition to see who can catch the heaviest fish.The winner gets a bottle of whiskey.They get their fish food from suppliers.No-one has any idea how many fish there are in the lake.The copse is 18 acres in size.It has lots of insects and animals.The trees included in the copse are Firs,Willows and Oaks.The disused water mill is thought to be haunted and there are no plans to restart it.
